text:
1. Burned out Prairie fires in the early days, knew it shocked.
2. Counted killed many sheepdogs of myself and others in great blizzards at Red Deer Rock around 1900.
3. Getting doctor to neighbor women in confinement.
4. I drew beef to supply construction gangs building railway (Anoka Line) 1888.
5. 3100 died 400 cattle north of Cochrane in 1902.
6. Went to high school at Caribou in 1904.
7. Knowing wood from Moose Mt. 50 mi in Blizzards.
8. Great blizzard on Oct. 12th, 1903. Blowed for 3 days and might be about four feet of snow some drifted 12 ft high. Burned all standing grain but stooks were all right.
1. General I. at Prairie time in the early days, bury at Shackle.

2. Contact killed many thousands of myself through in

3. Great Blizzard at Red River Station around 1900

4. Nothing shorter to neighbor women in confinement

5. Silver rush from Texas in mid-winter season about 5 days

6. I drive beef to supply construction gangs building

railway (Anoka Line) 1889

7. 3 herdled 400 cattle north of Cotton in 1902

8. Went to high school at Chipman in 1904

9. Knowing wood from Moose Mts. 50 mi in Wiggins

10. Great Blizzard on Dec. 12th, 1903. Blowed

for 3 days and might to about four feet of snow; some drifted 12 ft high. Burned all

standing grain but stocks were all right
